intro: Casearia cambessedesii, commonly known as the white casearia, is a tropical shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape and have a smooth surface. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in terminal umbels, producing a subtle fragrance. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that matures into a reddish color, containing several seeds.
